H0.text: Branchial arches are a series of arches that support the gills of aquatic amphibians and fish.

H1.text: Cochlear arches are a series of arches that support the gills of aquatic amphibians and fish.

H2.text: Aquatic arches are a series of arches that support the gills of aquatic amphibians and fish.

H3.text: Scythian arches are a series of arches that support the gills of aquatic amphibians and fish.

A4.text: Branchial arches or gill arches are a series of paired bony/cartilaginous 'loops' behind the throat (pharyngeal cavity) of fish, which support the fish gills.

A5.text: In amphibians and reptiles, only the oral jaws and a hyoid apparatus remains, and in mammals and birds the hyoid is simplified further to support the tongue and floor of the mouth.
